title: Japanese investors ditch foreign stocks on US economic concerns, tariff tensions
summary: Japanese investors significantly reduced their holdings in foreign stocks, withdrawing 752.1 billion yen last week, amidst global market concerns over the U.S. economic outlook and new trade tariffs.
fullContent: Japanese investors significantly reduced their holdings in foreign stocks, withdrawing 752.1 billion yen last week, amidst global market concerns over the U.S. economic outlook and new trade tariffs. This reverses a trend of net purchases, though year-to-date investments still show a substantial 3.37 trillion yen inflow. Simultaneously, they sold foreign long-term bonds.

title: Tata stocks lose over Rs 8 lakh crore in 11 months. Is it time to revisit your portfolio allocations?
summary: Tata Group's market capitalization plummeted by over Rs 8.25 lakh crore in 11 months due to global economic uncertainties and sector-specific challenges. Major stocks like TCS, Tata Motors, and Trent experienced significant declines, impacting overall group performance.
fullContent: Tata Group's market capitalization plummeted by over Rs 8.25 lakh crore in 11 months due to global economic uncertainties and sector-specific challenges. Major stocks like TCS, Tata Motors, and Trent experienced significant declines, impacting overall group performance. While some stocks showed resilience, the substantial value erosion prompts investors to reassess their portfolio allocations.

title: Ircon International shares in focus after Q1 PAT declines 27% YoY
summary: Ircon International reported a 26.7% YoY decline in Q1FY26 PAT to Rs 164.1 crore, with revenue also falling. Despite the earnings dip, the company maintained a robust order book of Rs 20,973 crore. It remains optimistic, citing strong government push for infrastructure through...
fullContent: Ircon International reported a 26.7% YoY decline in Q1FY26 PAT to Rs 164.1 crore, with revenue also falling. Despite the earnings dip, the company maintained a robust order book of Rs 20,973 crore. It remains optimistic, citing strong government push for infrastructure through initiatives like Gati Shakti and Bharatmala, positioning itself for future growth.

title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 24,500 after Trump's 50% tariff on India
summary: Indian stock markets faced a downturn as Sensex and Nifty50 started lower. This followed the US imposing tariffs, sparking economic worries. Adani Ports and Tata Motors were among the top losers. Global cues were mixed, with Asian markets showing gains.
fullContent: Indian stock markets faced a downturn as Sensex and Nifty50 started lower. This followed the US imposing tariffs, sparking economic worries. title: Hero MotoCorp shares rise 2% after Q1 profit beats estimates despite weak sales
summary: Hero MotoCorp shares: The company reported a net profit of ₹1,125.7 crore for the June quarter, slightly above last year’s ₹1,122.6 crore and beating market estimates despite lower sales. Revenue fell 5.6% YoY to ₹9,578.9 crore, and unit sales dropped 10.9% to 13.67 lakh.
fullContent: Hero MotoCorp shares: The company reported a net profit of ₹1,125.7 crore for the June quarter, slightly above last year’s ₹1,122.6 crore and beating market estimates despite lower sales. Revenue fell 5.6% YoY to ₹9,578.9 crore, and unit sales dropped 10.9% to 13.67 lakh. EBITDA was ₹1,382 crore, with a stable margin of 14.4%.

title: Airbnb forecasts Q3 revenue above estimates; plans $6 billion share buyback
summary: Airbnb anticipates third-quarter revenue exceeding Wall Street projections and has authorized a new $6 billion share repurchase program, boosting its stock. The company's growth was fueled by a surge in domestic travel within the U.S.
fullContent: Airbnb anticipates third-quarter revenue exceeding Wall Street projections and has authorized a new $6 billion share repurchase program, boosting its stock. The company's growth was fueled by a surge in domestic travel within the U.S., with nights booked accelerating throughout the second quarter. Despite potential moderation due to tougher comparisons, Airbnb remains optimistic, forecasting revenue between $4.02 billion and $4.

title: Oil Prices Rise After Trump Targets India's Imports
summary: Oil prices ticked higher in early Thursday trading in Asia, buoyed by renewed trade tensions and a surprise decline in U.S. crude inventories. The modest rebound follows a rough week for crude, which had slumped to two-month lows on concerns over rising OPEC+ output and...
fullContent: Oil prices ticked higher in early Thursday trading in Asia, buoyed by renewed trade tensions and a surprise decline in U.S. crude inventories. The modest rebound follows a rough week for crude, which had slumped to two-month lows on concerns over rising OPEC+ output and faltering global demand. At the time of writing, Brent crude futures for October delivery rose 0.88% to $67.48 per barrel, while West Texas Intermediate futures climbed by 0.98% to $64.98. The upward momentum was driven in part by a new wave of geopolitical uncertainty after President…

title: Japan's Topix hits record high on Wall Street rally, solid earnings
summary: Japan's Topix index soared to a record high, mirroring Wall Street's overnight gains and fueled by strong corporate earnings, reinforcing wage growth expectations. The Nikkei also climbed, continuing a three-day rally after Monday's sharp decline.
fullContent: Japan's Topix index soared to a record high, mirroring Wall Street's overnight gains and fueled by strong corporate earnings, reinforcing wage growth expectations. title: Trump’s Punitive India Tariff Spoils Modi’s Russian Oil Math
summary: A US decision to double tariffs on Indian goods as punishment for ongoing purchases of Russian crude leaves the world’s third-largest oil consumer in a tight spot and its refiners in disarray, but the move is unlikely to prompt a radical rethink in New Delhi.
fullContent: A US decision to double tariffs on Indian goods as punishment for ongoing purchases of Russian crude leaves the world’s third-largest oil consumer in a tight spot and its refiners in disarray, but the move is unlikely to prompt a radical rethink in New Delhi.

title: Gokaldas Exports, KPR Mill, other textile stocks in focus after Trump hikes tariff on India to 50%
summary: Indian textile stocks like Gokaldas Exports and KPR Mill may face pressure after US President Trump doubled tariffs on Indian goods to 50%. The hike, citing national security concerns over Russian oil imports, impacts textiles, gems, seafood, and more—excluding pharma and...
fullContent: Indian textile stocks like Gokaldas Exports and KPR Mill may face pressure after US President Trump doubled tariffs on Indian goods to 50%. The hike, citing national security concerns over Russian oil imports, impacts textiles, gems, seafood, and more—excluding pharma and electronics.

title: Trump hikes tariffs on India to 50%, scrambling the country’s plans to be an alternative to China
summary: "These actions are unfair, unjustified and unreasonable,” India Foreign Ministry spokesman Randhir Jaiswal said in a statement.
fullContent: "These actions are unfair, unjustified and unreasonable,” India Foreign Ministry spokesman Randhir Jaiswal said in a statement.

title: "Big Cuts This Year": UBP's Pang on Fed Rate Cuts
summary: UBP Asia Head of FX Sales & Execution Ignatius Pang believes two major rate cuts may be on the table before the end of the year. Pang speaks on Bloomberg TV after three Federal Reserve policymakers voiced concerns about the US labor market with remarks that pointed to a...
fullContent: UBP Asia Head of FX Sales & Execution Ignatius Pang believes two major rate cuts may be on the table before the end of the year. Pang speaks on Bloomberg TV after three Federal Reserve policymakers voiced concerns about the US labor market with remarks that pointed to a potential interest-rate cut in September. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Over half of Hong Kong residents plan to work past 65, survey shows
summary: More than half of Hong Kong residents do not plan to retire at the typical retirement age of 65, with many feeling that they cannot reach the average HK$5 million (US$637,000) savings target necessary for a comfortable post-work life, according to the T.
fullContent: More than half of Hong Kong residents do not plan to retire at the typical retirement age of 65, with many feeling that they cannot reach the average HK$5 million (US$637,000) savings target necessary for a comfortable post-work life, according to the T. Rowe Price Hong Kong Retirement Survey released on Thursday. About 52 per cent of respondents indicated they would not retire at age 65. Among them, about 80 per cent preferred not to retire at all or opted instead for a “micro-retirement”,...

title: New World Shares, Bonds Jump After Report on Financing Talks
summary: Distressed Hong Kong builder New World Development Co.’s shares and dollar bonds rose the most in several months after a report that the company and its controlling family are in talks for a potential financing deal for as much as $2.5 billion.
fullContent: Distressed Hong Kong builder New World Development Co.’s shares and dollar bonds rose the most in several months after a report that the company and its controlling family are in talks for a potential financing deal for as much as $2.5 billion.

title: New World Says No Share Offers From Blackstone, Family
summary: Distressed Hong Kong developer New World Development Co. said that Blackstone Inc. has not made an offer for its shares, following a media report on potential financing that triggered the biggest equity rally in several months.
fullContent: Distressed Hong Kong developer New World Development Co. said that Blackstone Inc. has not made an offer for its shares, following a media report on potential financing that triggered the biggest equity rally in several months.

title: Elgi Equipments, Bayer CropScience among 7 stocks that dropped below VWAP on August 6
Adani Power wins LoI for 2,400 MW thermal plant in Bihar
summary: Emerging as the lowest bidder at ₹6.075/kWh in a competitive tender, the project will be implemented under the DBFOO model with an estimated investment of $3 billion.
